uk.ac.ebi.centres.priority

Class AbstractPriorityRule<A>

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ebi.centres.priority.AbstractPriorityRule<A>
  • Type Parameters:
    A -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Comparator<Ligand<A>>, PriorityRule<A>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AtomicNumberRule, CombinedRule, DescriptorRule, DuplicateAtomRule, MassNumberRule, PairRule

    public abstract class AbstractPriorityRule<A>
extends java.lang.Object
implements PriorityRule<A>
    An abstract comparator that provides construction of the Comparison wrapper allowing subclasses to focus on the actual comparison of ligands.
    Author:
    John May

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface uk.ac.ebi.centres.PriorityRule

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractPriorityRule(Descriptor.Type reflection, PriorityRule.Type ordering)
      Constructor creates a comparator with the specified type.
      AbstractPriorityRule(PriorityRule.Type ordering)
      Default constructor creates an Descriptor.Type#ASYMMETRIC comparator.

      • compareLigands

        public Comparison compareLigands(Ligand<A> o1,
                                 Ligand<A> o2)
        Description copied from interface: PriorityRule
        Analogous to Comparator.compare(Object, Object) the prioritise method combines the Descriptor.Type to the order and can indicate what comparison method was used. The single comparison cases the type doesn't change however when using a combined comparator the type may change depending on which comparator was used.
        Specified by:
        compareLigands in interface PriorityRule<A>
        Parameters:
        o1 - first ligand
        o2 - second ligand
        Returns:
        the order of the two objects
        See Also:
        Comparator.compare(Object, Object)

      • setSorter

        public void setSorter(LigandSorter<A> sorter)
        Description copied from interface: PriorityRule
        Allows injection of a ligand sorter. The ligand sort is used when two compared ligands are ranked equally. The sorter needs to be injected for as when combination of priority rules is required the sorting must be done all proceeding rules.
        Specified by:
        setSorter in interface PriorityRule<A>
        Parameters:
        sorter - the ligand sorter to use

      • getSorter

        public LigandSorter<A> getSorter()
        Access the ligand sorter, if the sorter is null a default insertion sorter (InsertionSorter) is created using 'this; rule as the comparator.
        Returns:
        a set ligand sorter or a newly created insertion sorter

      • prioritise

        public Priority prioritise(java.util.List<Ligand<A>> ligands)
        Uses the injected ligand sorter to order the ligands.
        Specified by:
        prioritise in interface PriorityRule<A>
        Parameters:
        ligands - the ligands that are to be sorted
        Returns:
        whether the ligands are unique

      • compare

        public int compare(java.util.List<Ligand<A>> first,
                   java.util.List<Ligand<A>> second)
        Compares two lists of ligands. The ligands are first sorted and then iteratively compared by the sub-class comparator. If no different is found whilst iterating through the list the larger of the two lists wins or a tie is determined.
        Parameters:
        first - first list of ligands
        second - second list of ligands
        Returns:
        the value of the comparison

        Description copied from interface: PriorityRule
        Access the descriptor type this rule indicates. Normally rules will indicate. In rare cases a rule produce a pseudo-asymmetric centre.
        Specified by:
